articles.title: Exercise ‘better than drugs’ to stop cancer returning after treatment, trial finds - The Guardian
articles.summary: Fund independent journalism with $15 per month After five years, patients in an exercise regime had a 28% lower risk of recurrent or new cancers. Photograph: amriphoto/Getty Images Exercise ‘better than drugs’ to stop cancer returning after treatment, trial finds First clear evidence that structured exercise regime reduces risk of dying by a third, can stop tumours coming back or...

articles.title: Trump administration’s deep cuts to public health leave system reeling - PBS
articles.summary: Michelle R. Smith, Associated Press Trump administration’s deep cuts to public health leave system reeling Health May 31, 2025 6:15 PM EDT CHARLOTTE, N. C. (AP) — Americans are losing a vast array of people and programs dedicated to keeping them healthy. Gone are specialists who were confronting a measles outbreak in Ohio, workers who drove a van to schools...
